meanings.definition: The central axis or shaft of a feather.
meanings.sent1: The rhachises of the feather provide structure and support.
meanings.sent2: Birds use their rhachises to control the direction of flight.
meanings.sent3: The rhachises of the feathers on the costume fluttered in the wind during the play.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was the rhachises that held the team together during the project.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the rhachises made the bird's plumage stunning.

meanings.definition: The main stem of a compound leaf.
meanings.sent1: The rhachises of the compound leaf help in photosynthesis.
meanings.sent2: The rhachises of the leaf branch out to support multiple leaflets.
meanings.sent3: The rhachises of the leaf danced in the breeze, creating a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the rhachises that fueled her success in gardening.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the rhachises of the leaf were fascinating to study.

meanings.definition: The central axis of a spikelet in grasses.
meanings.sent1: The rhachises of the spikelet provide structure to the grass.
meanings.sent2: The rhachises of the grass spikelet help in seed dispersal.
meanings.sent3: The rhachises of the grass swayed gracefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent4: His leadership was the rhachises that guided the team through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The fragility of the rhachises in the grass spikelet symbolized the delicate balance of nature.
